page.title: 19HOUSING IN SUTTON
page.content: A great range of styles and period of house is to be found in Sutton.There are 3 types of council houses_those at the Crossroads having been built following the first world war and those at Clay End and the eastern end of the High Street after the second world war.The majority are 3-bedroomed semi-detached homes.There are some bungalows for the elderly.The more modern houses are generally of the executive type many of which overlook the golf course.There are several small Victorian terraces built for farm workers around 1870.On these can be seen the Burgoyne family crest. There are a number of houses of historical interest in the village_ The Old Rectory,Church Farm which is part Tudor and part Stuart,Village Farm built in 1630 and several others.
